title: Expand Services & Pricing page with full 30-item catalog and gradient 3D icon styling

requirements.text: Update the existing Services & Pricing page to render the provided complete pricing catalog as grouped sections with all 30 offerings and their exact INR prices and bullet features, using English section headings (no emoji-only headings).

acceptanceCriteria: The Services & Pricing page shows all 30 offerings, each with its name, INR price formatted with the ‚Çπ symbol, and the exact bullet list items provided by the user.

Offerings are grouped under clear English section headers that correspond to the user‚Äôs groupings (e.g., ‚ÄúWebsite Packages‚Äù, ‚ÄúWhatsApp Automation‚Äù, ‚ÄúLead Generation Systems‚Äù, ‚ÄúPersonal Brand Services‚Äù, ‚ÄúSEO Services‚Äù, ‚ÄúAI & Automation‚Äù, ‚ÄúBusiness Systems‚Äù, ‚ÄúOutreach Systems‚Äù, ‚ÄúE-commerce‚Äù, ‚ÄúStudent Special Packages‚Äù, ‚ÄúComplete Low-Ticket Growth Engine‚Äù).
No offerings from the user list are missing or merged; each appears as its own card/listing.

requirements.text: Apply a gradient-themed visual style to the Services & Pricing page, including gradient card accents/backgrounds and consistent premium styling (spacing, typography hierarchy), while keeping all user-facing text in English.

quotes: create these in pricing with gradiend theme & gradient 3D icons

acceptanceCriteria: The pricing page uses visible gradient styling (e.g., subtle gradient background and/or gradient borders/highlights on cards) consistently across sections and cards.
The page remains mobile-first and responsive (single-column on small screens, multi-column grids on larger screens).
All headings, buttons, and helper text displayed to users are English.

requirements.text: Add and render gradient-styled 3D icons for the pricing catalog categories/offerings on the Services & Pricing page, using the existing ServiceNiche3dIcon component and icon mapping, with a safe fallback if an icon asset is missing.
acceptanceCriteria: Each pricing section (or each offering card) displays a 3D icon near the title area.
Icons load via static frontend assets (no backend image serving) and are base-path safe.
If an icon fails to load, the existing SafeImage fallback renders a non-technical fallback (e.g., initials) and the page remains usable.

requirements.text: Replace the current single ‚ÄúMonthly Maintenance‚Äù card on the Services & Pricing page with a ‚ÄúMonthly Maintenance Plans‚Äù section that shows exactly 3 plans (Student ‚Çπ499/month, Business ‚Çπ999/month, Pro ‚Çπ1,999/month) and the included bullets: Minor updates, Basic support, Monitoring.

quotes:

acceptanceCriteria: The pricing page shows a ‚ÄúMonthly Maintenance Plans‚Äù section containing exactly three plan cards/entries: Student, Business, Pro, with the exact monthly prices provided.
Each maintenance plan displays the included bullets: ‚ÄúMinor updates‚Äù, ‚ÄúBasic support‚Äù, ‚ÄúMonitoring‚Äù.
The previous single maintenanceTier presentation is no longer shown on the page.

requirements.text: Ensure each offering and maintenance plan displays clear CTAs consistent with the app‚Äôs pricing flow (at minimum: a visible ‚ÄúSelect Plan‚Äù and a visible ‚ÄúGet Started‚Äù action per offering/plan), and keep the existing CheckoutDialog integration working when a CTA triggers checkout.

quotes: Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.

acceptanceCriteria: Every offering card includes two visible buttons labeled ‚ÄúSelect Plan‚Äù and ‚ÄúGet Started‚Äù.
Clicking at least one of the CTAs per offering opens the existing CheckoutDialog with the correct service name and amount for that offering.
Buttons are English-labeled and remain readable/accessible on mobile.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn UI sources); compose existing components instead.
Do not edit immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Serve pricing icons as static frontend assets (place under frontend/public/assets/generated) and reference them via the existing base-path-aware publicAssetUrl helper (no backend image serving).
Keep all user-facing text in English on the updated pricing page.
nonGoals: Do not change backend data models or persistence for Services as part of this request.
Do not redesign or rewrite the login/authentication flow as part of this request.
Do not implement new payment providers; only keep the existing CheckoutDialog entry working from the pricing page.
